title: Restaurants' most expensive wine bottles
text: Videos Restaurants' most expensive wine bottles In Santa Monica, Calif., two Michelin-starred Mélisse restaurant has bottles of 2002 and 2003 Domaine de la Romanèe Conti available for $23,000 each. The wine comes from a five-acre vineyard (dating back to the Romans), which is known for many things such as the ability to restore life to the dying. Mélisse At New York City's historic '21' Club, wine director Phil Pratt's most expensive offering is a bottle of 1985 Romanee-Conti Domaine de la Romanee Conti for $22,000. '21' Club Among its wine collection, Travelle at the Langham, Chicago has a bottle of J.F. Coche-Dury, Corton Charlemagne, 1998. Try the vintage, full bodied burgundy for $4,500. Travelle at the Langham, Chicago Travelle also offers a a Tâche, 1990 for $7,500. Travelle at the Langham, Chicago America's oldest restaurant, Delmonico's was actually the very first restaurant to offer a wine list menu. Today, the Manhattan landmark's most expensive offering is a 6L bottle of Meritage, Opus One from Napa Valley 2009 for $7,245. Delmonico's Opt for cabernet sauvignon with a $5,250 bottle of Screaming Eagle, 2010. Travelle at the Langham, Chicago Spago Beverly Hills has one of the very few magnum bottles of Domaine de la Romanee Conti Richebourg 1997, one of the rarest and most sought after burgundies in the world, for $6,500. Spago Beverly Hills At Chicago's Spiaggia, wine director Rachael Loweoffersa bottle of 'Sassicaia,' Tenuta San Guido 1985 for $6,000. Spiaggia Also find a magnum of Barolo Riserva 'Monfortino,' Giacomo Conterno, Monforte 1970 for $3,000. Spiaggia At Boston's Grill 23 & Bar, find a 1961 La Mission Haut Brion, from one of the most legendary vintages in the history of Bordeaux, for $5,500. Grill 23 & Bar A 1990 Le Pin, Pomerol, the original garagiste Bordeaux from a benchmark vintage -- rarely seen in the U.S. -- is also available for $4,100. Grill 23 & Bar At LA's Faith & Flower, find a 2011 Domaine Romanee Conti, La Tache from wine director Jared Hooper for $2,500. Faith & Flower At New York City's Le BIbloquet, wine director Craig Pogson serves a very exclusive Bordeaux called Chateau Mouton Rothschild 2005 from Pauillac for $2,400. Le BIbloquet At City Winery Nashville, find a bottle of Chateau Margaux Grand Vin, Grand Cru Classe 1990 for $2,100. City Winery Nashville Winston restaurant in Mt. Kisco, N.Y. hosts exclusive and rare offerings in its wine cellar, including a bottle of Chateau Laville Haut-Brion 2004, Pessac-Leognan, France for $1,691. Winston restaurant CUT at the Beverly Wilshire hotel has a 2007 Case Basse di Soldera Sangiovese of Toscana IGT classification from the remaining barrels that were not drained by a disgruntled employee in 2012. The rare bottle goes for $1,600. CUT at the Beverly Wilshire New York City's PUBLIC restaurant offers a Magnum of Penfolds Grange 2003 for $1,660. Michael Weber California's Calistoga Ranch hosts a wine cellar valued at over $500,000, which includes a $1,300 bottle of Napa Valley’s Colgin IX Estate 2011. Calistoga Ranch New York City's trendy Saxon + Parole has a 3L bottle of Domaine Pegau 2003 Chateauneuf du Pape, Rhone Valley, France for $1,200. Saxon + Parole Also find a bottle of Domaine de la Romanee Conti Grand Cru "Eschezeaux" 2010 Burgundy, France for $800. Saxon + Parole Opt for a bottle of Dominus Cabernet Sauvignon 2006, Napa Valley, Calif. for $500. Saxon + Parole Chicago's mk restaurant, from wine enthusiast chef Michael Kornick, offers a ‘97 Quintarelli Giuseppe, ‘Alzero’ Cabernet Franc for $890. mk In Yountville, Calif., Lucy Restaurant & Bar offers a bottle of 2009 Angelo Gaja, Nebbiolo, 'Sori Tildin', Langhe, Piemonte, Italy for $875. Lucy Restaurant & Bar Chicago's Sepia, known for its wine list, has a ‘97 Salon Le Mesnil, Blanc de Blancs, Le Mesnil-sur-Oger Champagne for $866. Sepia Steak & Whisky in Hermosa Beach, Calif. offers a bottle of 2012 ZD Abacus Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa Valley, Calif. for $760. Steak & Whisky In D.C., Del Campo offers a bottle of 2009 Nebbiolo, the Gaja, from Piedmont, Italy for $600. Greg Powers Napa, Calif.'s 1313 Main offers a 2005 Continuum, Proprietary Red - Napa Valley for $628. 1313 Main 1313 Main also has a bottle of 1983 Dominus Estate, Red Wine - Napa Valley for $504. 1313 Main The Plaza Hotel Champagne Bar has a magnum of the 1999 Palmes d’Or available for $600. Nicolas Feuillatte At Lincoln Center’s Metropolitan Opera House, the Grand Tier Restaurant offers Nicolas Feuillatte’s 2002 Palmes d’Or for $290. Filip Wolak New York City's The Lambs Club offers a Michel Chapoutier, Ermitage “Le Pavillon” 2006 for $584. The Lambs Club Find a 1990 chateau de Beaucastel for $470 at Paris Club Bistro & Bar in Chicago. Paris Club Bistro & Bar In California's Livermore Valley Wine Country, The Restaurant at Wente Vineyards offers its the 1959 Wente Bros. Sauternes, Livermore Valley for $450. Wente Vineyards There are only 10 bottles left of the Chateau Wente Sauternes, which have been passed through three generations of the Wente family, stored underground, and are only opened on very special occasions. Wente Vineyards Fullscreen At San Francisco's French bistro Nico, a Chateau Musar Rosé from the Bekaa Valley Lebanon is available for $88. The scarce rosé isn't produced every year, and is a unique blend of two white varietals (Obiadeh and Merweh, which are indigenous to Lebanon) and one red varietal (Cinsault). Nico At neighboring restaurants Minton's and The Cecil in Harlem, find Chateau Margaux, Margaux 1995 Bordeaux France, a Cabernet Sauvignon, for $1,050. Minton's A bottle of Hubert Lignier Vielles Vignes Morey-St. Denis 1er Cru 2000 Burgundy, France goes for $600. Minton's A bottle of Sauzet grand cru Bienvenues-Batard-Montrachet 2005 Burgundy France costs $500. Minton's For tempranillo, find a Lopez de Heredia Tondonia Gran Reserva 1981 Rioja Spain for $450.
